nodes.bodyText: Why does this link to pricing? Is there a better page of documentation which discusses how long a revision will be maintained?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -612,8 +612,10 @@ /** * Lists chronological/historical representation of {@link ConfigurationSetting} resource(s). Revisions are provided - * in descending order from their {@link ConfigurationSetting#getLastModified() lastModified} date. Revisions expire - * after a period of time. The service maintains change history for up to 7 days. + * in descending order from their {@link ConfigurationSetting#getLastModified() lastModified} date. + * Revisions expire after a period of time. + *

See Pricing + * for more information.

nodes.bodyText: key History in pricing. Price = free, 7 days; Price = standard, 30 days. Keep it as link as we don't want to set it to fixed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -612,8 +612,10 @@ /** * Lists chronological/historical representation of {@link ConfigurationSetting} resource(s). Revisions are provided - * in descending order from their {@link ConfigurationSetting#getLastModified() lastModified} date. Revisions expire - * after a period of time. The service maintains change history for up to 7 days. + * in descending order from their {@link ConfigurationSetting#getLastModified() lastModified} date. + * Revisions expire after a period of time. + *

See Pricing + * for more information.

nodes.bodyText:
I think we should leave the last sentence as a single sentence, no need to break it up due to the hyperlink. This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters Suggested change * Revisions expire after a period of time. *

See Pricing * for more information.

* Revisions expire after a period of time, see this documentation * for more information.

nodes.bodyText: We should be compatible with any distribution of JDK 8+ and not just azure_jdk. Is there a reason for linking to Azure JDK distribution here?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -12,7 +12,7 @@ Use the client library for App Configuration to create and manage application co
 
 ### Prerequisites
 
-- Java Development Kit (JDK) with version 8 or above
+- [Java Development Kit (JDK)][azure_jdk] with version 8 or above
